question_title: What will be the value of "Overnight Repurchase Agreements: Treasury Securities Purchased by the Federal Reserve in the Temporary Open Market Operations" on 2026-02-10?
summary: The RPONTSYD series tracks temporary open market repo operations, which have been essentially dormant since mid-2020 when the Standing Repo Facility (SRF) replaced them as the Fed's liquidity backstop. Recent values are consistently 0.000-0.002 billion. Current market conditions are stable (Fed ended QT Dec 2025, implemented reserve management purchases), and February 10 is a normal business day with no stress catalysts. The distribution is heavily concentrated near zero with a small tail for unexpected market events.

factors.description: Recent data consistently near zero (0.000-0.002 billion for past week)
Temporary repo operations formally discontinued Jan 2021, replaced by Standing Repo Facility
Current market conditions stable - Fed ended QT, no liquidity stress indicators
February 10 is normal Tuesday, no tax deadlines or major settlement dates
Small tail risk: unexpected market stress could require Fed intervention
